message:
كنت بستخدم gem اسمها gendered بتعرف الجنس ( ذكر/انثى) من الاسم وشغالة كويس مع الاسماء العربي اللى مكتوبة بالانجلش وكنت محتاج نفس الـ Function بس مع الاسماء المكتوبة بالعربي فبدءت ال gem دي وسميتها "اسماء" وفيها لحد الان 2430 اسم وهحاول ازودهم كل فترة واحسن فى ال gem نفسها عشان نقدر تقول ان دة يدوبك نسخة بيتا.
I am using a gem called "gendered" to detect the gender of the name and it's working fine with the Arabian names which written in English but I needed a gem to do the same for the names which written in Arabic so I created "Asmaa" gem with just 2430 names and its genders and I will try to do my best to increase the number
https://rubygems.org/gems/asmaa
story: Morad Edwar shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Morxander/asmaa-gem
caption: github.com
description: asmaa-gem - This is a simple gem to know any Arabian name gender

data.message:
طيب موش سميتها عطيات ليه بدل أسماء؟! :)
ربنا يقويك.

this is soo cool.
What about جهاد وولاء وصفاء؟
خلي بالك: هتواجه مشكلة ثقافية. في السعودية مثلا اسماء زي جمعة وعطية دي مؤنث في حين في مصر جمعة ده راجل بن راجل! :)

good work, but I think it won't work in production since sqlite3 is not added as a dependency (only added to development dependencies)...
another thing... I'd recommend using something else as a datastore (instead of sqlite db)... like for example a stored hash or yml file that can be loaded into a hash... therefore querying the hash is much faster than querying the db ... and less dependencies added to the project (check https://www.mikeperham.com/2016/02/09/kill-your-dependencies/)
on the other hand it'll consume a lot of memory depending on the size of that hash... you might also want to optimize the hash solution... so on top of my mind you can store the names (sorted) on a file and binary search that file lines...
great work, and I'm sure that you can optimize it even more

You may want to check this out:
https://github.com/Shnoulle/Ar-PHP/blob/master/Arabic/data/female.txt
